constraints.constraint: Container/Presenter Pattern: Page components fetch data using TanStack Query hooks, presentational components display data passed as props. Keeps concerns separated.
Query Invalidation: Use TanStack Query's invalidateQueries() on WebSocket events to trigger automatic refetching. No manual state management needed.
Optimistic Updates: Update UI immediately on user actions, rollback on API error. Provides better UX.
Skeleton Loading: Show skeleton screens while loading instead of spinners. Better perceived performance.
Error Boundaries: Wrap pages in error boundaries to gracefully handle errors with retry options.
Responsive Design: Mobile-first approach with breakpoints (mobile: <768px, tablet: 768px-1024px, desktop: >1024px). Use Tailwind responsive classes.
Query Caching: TanStack Query caches API responses (5min stale time for list view, 2min for detail view). Background refetch every 30s for lists, 10s for detail.
WebSocket Efficiency: Single WebSocket connection shared across components using useWebSocket hook. Don't create multiple connections.
Debounced Search: 500ms debounce on search input to reduce API calls and improve performance.
Test Framework: Vitest + React Testing Library. Co-locate tests with source files (*.test.tsx pattern).
Coverage Target: Minimum 70% code coverage per component. Run tests with npm test, coverage with npm run test:coverage.
Test Pattern: Render component, assert content, test interactions, verify behavior. Mock API calls and WebSocket events.
Authentication: All API calls include JWT token from localStorage (handled automatically by BaseAPI class).
Input Sanitization: Search input sanitized before sending to API. React automatically escapes rendered content for XSS protection.
File Organization: Pages in dashboard/src/pages/, feature components in dashboard/src/components/projects/, shared UI in dashboard/src/components/ui/, hooks in dashboard/src/hooks/.
TypeScript Types: Define types in dashboard/src/types/project.ts. Export all interfaces for reuse across components.

tests.standards: Testing uses Vitest 1.0.4 as test runner with React Testing Library 14.1.2 for component testing. Tests are co-located with source files using *.test.tsx naming convention. Test pattern follows: import from test-utils, render component with test-utils/test-utils.tsx wrapper (provides QueryClient and Router context), assert content with screen queries, test user interactions with @testing-library/user-event, verify behavior with expect assertions. Mock API calls with vi.fn(), mock WebSocket with custom mock implementation. Minimum 70% code coverage required. Run tests: npm test, watch mode: npm run test:watch, coverage: npm run test:coverage.
